page.title: 03RAIL COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: THE LONDON TO PENZANCE RAILWAY LINE PASSES THROUGH THE AREA ON A FALLING GRADIENT APPROXAMATELY 275 FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL AT THE FOOT OF A STEEP WOODED ESCARPMENT TO THE SOUTH EAST WITH FLAT FARMLAND OPPOSITE. THE DOUBLE TRACK IS LAID ON CONCRETE SLEEPERS WITH COLOURED LIGHT SIGNALLING. TRAINS ARE DEISEL POWERED THERE IS NO STATION. PASSENGER TRAINS AVERAGE 15 IN EACH DIRECTION DAILY. FREIGHT TRAFFIC (MOSTLY STONE FROM SOMERSET QUARRYS) TO LONDON IN OPEN STEEL WAGONS UP TO 40 WAGONS PER TRAIN. EMPTY WAGONS RETURN 24 MOVEMENTS EACH WEEK DAY. 4 PARCEL TRAINS DAILY INCLUDING MAIL AND NEWSPAPERS AT NIGHT. THE LINE IS CROSSED BY ONE MINOR ROAD UNDER BRIDGE 1 FOOTPATH BRIDGE AND 1 FOOTPATH LEVEL CROSSING. NEAREST STATION IS 8 MILES EAST.
